Pre-Game Insights: Cricket West Indies (CWI) announced the West Indies Men’s squad for the upcoming T20 International (T20I) series against South Africa, scheduled to take place from 23 – 27 August 2024 in Trinidad.
Andre Russell requested a period of rest and recovery, as well as Jason Holder, who played five back-to-back Tests against England and South Africa.
Head Coach Daren Sammy remarked that facing a strong South Africa side is an excellent opportunity for the team to reset and refocus with their game plan.
The West Indies Men’s T20 team have won four of their last five series and just missed out on a Semi-Final place at the recently concluded ICC Men’s T20 World Cup.
In the ICC Men’s T20I Team Rankings, West Indies are number 4 and South Africa are number 5.

The matches will be part of doubleheaders with the Massy Women’s Caribbean Premier League (WCPL), marking the first time that WI Men’s Internationals will be part of a doubleheader with a Women’s franchise competition.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tickets for the T20I Series against South Africa at the Brian Lara Cricket Academy, Trinidad are available now to buy online from the Windies Tickets service.
Fans in the Caribbean can watch live on RUSH SPORTS or via the new Flow Sports App or the SportsMax App.
Fans around the world can listen live to ball-by-ball radio commentary on the Windies Cricket YouTube page and can follow live ball-by-ball scores on the windiescricket.com Match Centre.
